channel.title: [PI/FormationX] Client Run file
channel.description: Basically, I was wondering if anyone has a run file that detects your JDK version to run rather than having to change it? I've seen it don't I just don't have it.

item.title: [PI/FormationX] Client Run file
item.dc:creator: @osm osm
item.description:
@osm wrote:

u just need find your jdk version or use this @echo off
echo Compiling core…
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_26\bin\javac” -d bin -cp deps/jython.jar;deps/log4j-1.2.15.jar;deps/mina-core-1.1.7.jar;deps/slf4j-api-1.5.3.jar;deps/slf4j-log4j12-1.5.3.jar;xpp3-1.1.4c.jar;deps/xstream-1.3.1-20081003.103259-2.jar;deps/xpp3-1.1.4c.jar -sourcepath src src/edu/Main.java
echo Compiling loginserver…
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_26\bin\javac” -d bin -cp deps/jython.jar;deps/log4j-1.2.15.jar;deps/mina-core-1.1.7.jar;deps/slf4j-api-1.5.3.jar;deps/slf4j-log4j12-1.5.3.jar;xpp3-1.1.4c.jar;deps/xstream-1.3.1-20081003.103259-2.jar;deps/xpp3-1.1.4c.jar -sourcepath src src/edu/Main.java
echo Compiling packet handlers…
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_26\bin\javac” -d bin -cp deps/jython.jar;deps/log4j-1.2.15.jar;deps/mina-core-1.1.7.jar;deps/slf4j-api-1.5.3.jar;deps/slf4j-log4j12-1.5.3.jar;xpp3-1.1.4c.jar;deps/xstream-1.3.1-20081003.103259-2.jar;deps/xpp3-1.1.4c.jar -sourcepath src src/edu/packethandler/.java
echo Compiling logging system…
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_26\bin\javac” -d bin -cp deps/jython.jar;deps/log4j-1.2.15.jar;deps/mina-core-1.1.7.jar;deps/slf4j-api-1.5.3.jar;deps/slf4j-log4j12-1.5.3.jar;xpp3-1.1.4c.jar;deps/xstream-1.3.1-20081003.103259-2.jar;deps/xpp3-1.1.4c.jar -sourcepath src src/edu/util/log/SLF4JAppender.java
echo Compiling tools…
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_26\bin\javac” -d bin -cp deps/jython.jar;deps/log4j-1.2.15.jar;deps/mina-core-1.1.7.jar;deps/slf4j-api-1.5.3.jar;deps/slf4j-log4j12-1.5.3.jar;xpp3-1.1.4c.jar;deps/xstream-1.3.1-20081003.103259-2.jar;deps/xpp3-1.1.4c.jar -sourcepath src src/edu/tools/.java
echo Complete.
pause
